name: imap-email
description: Read and manage email via IMAP (ProtonMail Bridge, Gmail, etc.). Check for new/unread messages, fetch content, search mailboxes, and mark as read/unread. Works with any IMAP server including ProtonMail Bridge.
author: Mike Varrieur

required.name: IMAP_HOST
required.description: IMAP server hostname (e.g., imap.gmail.com or 127.0.0.1 for ProtonMail Bridge)

required.name: IMAP_PORT
required.description: IMAP server port (e.g., 993 for SSL, 143 for STARTTLS, 1143 for ProtonMail Bridge)

required.name: IMAP_USER
required.description: IMAP username (typically your full email address)

required.name: IMAP_TLS
required.description: Whether to use TLS/SSL (true for SSL, false for STARTTLS)

optional.name: IMAP_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED
optional.description: Reject unauthorized SSL certificates (set to false for self-signed certs like ProtonMail Bridge)

notes: Install and run ProtonMail Bridge application
Bridge must be running for IMAP access
Password is generated by Bridge (not your ProtonMail password)
Set IMAP_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=false for Bridge's self-signed cert
Use App Password if 2FA is enabled
Allow less secure apps if not using 2FA (not recommended)
Consult your email provider's IMAP settings
Typically port 993 for SSL or 143 for STARTTLS
Most providers require full email address as username
Run 'npm install' in the skill directory to install required packages
Create .env file with IMAP credentials before use
Requires network access to IMAP server
Never commit credentials to version control
ProtonMail Bridge requires local Bridge application running
risks: Credential exposure if .env is committed to version control
Network interception if not using TLS
mitigations: Only set REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=false for trusted local servers (ProtonMail Bridge)

examples.description: Search for unread emails from last 24 hours
